Patent Information.Patent Title: Selectively targeted antimicrobial peptides and the use thereof.
Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention relates to targeting peptides capable of specifically binding to microbial organisms (e.g., P. aeruginosa or S. mutans), antimicrobial peptides having antimicrobial activities, and specifically/selectively targeted antimicrobial peptides (STAMPs). In addition, the present invention provides methods of selectively killing or inhibiting microbial organisms by using the peptides or compositions provided by the present invention.

Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Buforin-2 (Buforin II; Fragment of Histone H2A; toads, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the histone H2A family
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus subtilis (MIC=2 µg/ml), Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=4 µg/ml), Streptococcus mutans (MIC=2 µg/ml), Streptococcus pneumoniae (MIC=4 µg/ml), Pseudomonas putida (MIC=2 µg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli (MIC=4 µg/ml), Salmonella typhimurium (MIC=1 µg/ml), Serratia sp. (MIC=4 µg/ml).Fungi:Candida albicans (MIC=1 µg/ml), Cryptococcus neoformans (MIC=1 µg/ml), Saccharomyces cerevisiae (MIC=1 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Histones thereby play a central role in transcription regulation, DNA repair, DNA replication and chromosomal stability. Both buforin II and its derivative buforin IIb (sequence
Sequence Information.PTM: Monoubiquitination of C-terminus gives a specific tag for epigenetic transcriptional repression. Following DNA double-strand breaks (DSBs), it is ubiquitinated through 'Lys-63' linkage of ubiquitin moieties.

Literature.Title: A novel antimicrobial peptide from Bufo bufo gargarizans.
Literature.Author: Park C.B, Kim M.S, Kim S.C.

Literature.Title: Solution structure of an antimicrobial peptide buforin II.
